titles.title: A joint resolution designating September 10, 1993, as "National POW/MIA Recognition Day" and authorizing the display of the National League of Families POW/MIA flag.

action.text: Submitted in the Senate, read twice, considered, read the third time, and passed without amendment and with a preamble by Voice Vote.
Referred jointly to the House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service.
Referred jointly to the House Committee on Veterans' Affairs.
Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Committee on Post Office and Civil Service discharged.
Mr. Wynn asked unanimous consent to discharge from committees and consider.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

committee.name: House Post Office and Civil Service

bill.summary: 8/6/1993--Introduced. Designates September 10, 1993, as National POW/MIA Recognition Day. Requires the display of the National League of Families POW/MIA flag at: (1) all national cemeteries and the National Vietnam Veterans Memorial on May 31, 1993 (Memorial Day), September 10, 1993 (National POW/MIA Recognition Day), and November 11, 1993 (Veterans Day); and (2) the White House and the buildings containing the primary offices of the Secretaries of State, Defense, and Veterans Affairs and the Director of the Selective Service System on September 10, 1993 (National POW/MIA Recognition Day).
